qas.question: What were the three offshoots of Cubism formed in France?

answers.text: Orphism, Abstract art and later Purism

qas.question: What were the other offshoots formed in countries other than France?

answers.text: Futurism, Suprematism, Dada, Constructivism and De Stijl

qas.question: Which offshoot had little in common with Cubism?
Which offshoot of cubism was influenced by Picasso?

plausible_answers.text: Orphism, Abstract art and later Purism

qas.question: What were the four offshoots of Cubism formed in France?

plausible_answers.text: Futurism, Suprematism, Dada, Constructivism and De Stijl

qas.question: What were the other offshoots formed in France?
Which offshoot had everything in common with Cubism?
Which offshoot of cubism was not influenced by Picasso?

context: In France, offshoots of Cubism developed, including <a0_0><b4_0>Orphism, Abstract art and later Purism<b4_0/><a0_0/>. In other countries <a1_0><b5_0>Futurism, Suprematism, Dada, Constructivism and De Stijl<b5_0/><a1_0/> developed in response to Cubism. Early <a2_0><b6_0>Futurist<b6_0/><a2_0/> paintings hold in common with Cubism the fusing of the past and the present, the representation of different views of the subject pictured at the same time, also called multiple perspective, simultaneity or multiplicity, while <a3_0><b7_0>Constructivism<b7_0/><a3_0/> was influenced by Picasso's technique of constructing sculpture from separate elements. Other common threads between these disparate movements include the faceting or simplification of geometric forms, and the association of mechanization and modern life.
